name: Madagascar
hint: Fourth-largest island in the world, home to unique wildlife found nowhere else

name: Zanzibar
hint: Spice island off Tanzania's coast, famous for cloves and Stone Town's heritage

name: Mauritius
hint: Island nation in the Indian Ocean east of Madagascar, former home of the dodo

name: Reunion
hint: French overseas department in the Indian Ocean with one of the world's most active volcanoes

name: Seychelles
hint: Archipelago of 115 islands in the Indian Ocean, smallest African country by population

name: Comoros
hint: Volcanic archipelago between Madagascar and Mozambique, known for ylang-ylang perfume

name: Sao Tome
hint: Largest island of Sao Tome and Principe in the Gulf of Guinea, right on the equator

name: Cape Verde
hint: Volcanic archipelago off West Africa, a crossroads of African and Portuguese culture

name: Bioko Island
hint: Volcanic island in the Gulf of Guinea, home to Equatorial Guinea's capital Malabo

name: Lamu Island
hint: Kenyan island with one of the oldest Swahili settlements, a UNESCO World Heritage Site

name: Pemba Island
hint: The Green Island of Tanzania known for clove production and world-class diving

name: Canary Islands
hint: Spanish archipelago off northwest Africa, popular tourist destination with volcanic landscapes
